name: Hix Island House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While we had a wonderful time on Vieques, I don't know that I'd stay at Hix again after our experience. Most of the bugs were avoidable by wearing bug spray all the time - it is open air, so this is a necessity - sleeping under the mosquito netting in the room.
reviews.title: Nice setting, but bedbug central

likes.liked: — The view and the party with the owner

reviews.text: However, I was eaten alive by bedbugs, which mosquito netting didn't protect against. When I alerted the staff to this fact, their initial reaction was to do all they could to fix it - they sprayed the room extensively, got new sheets etc since they were full that night. We also got a new room the next day, but it was worse. There was no staff reaction when I alerted them to the same problem in a different room.
reviews.title: Luxury camping for too much money!

likes.liked: — The pool and really great staff.
likes.disliked: — Price combined with lack of comfort.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did enjoy the decor, feel and atmosphere of the place, but without a guarantee of no bedbugs I wouldn't stay there again.
reviews.title: Haute couture camping

likes.liked: — Well-appointed and well-designed rooms that were open-air

reviews.title: The good and the bad about vieques
reviews.text: A friend and I stayed here while in Vieques for a wedding. Having read the reviews on Trip Advisor, I was at least forewarned about what kind of experience this would be, but I never expected it to be as extreme as it was.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As others have stated here, there are people who love this hotel and the experience they get with it, but for about $300 per night, it is really not for me.
reviews.title: Absolutely incredible and worth every penny!

likes.liked: — The amazing architecture and rooms, and the incredible service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All I can say is "wow!" My girlfriend and I just returned from a magical four day stay at Hix. We stayed in the Adobe Loft, which was on the ground floor with a very private patio on which we got massages one afternoon. The trip was one of the most relaxing I have ever had and our stay was a centerpoint for that.
reviews.title: Concrete Paradise Nestled in the Jungle

likes.liked: — The building's relationship with its surroundings

reviews.title: Heaven on Earth!
reviews.text: The Hix House is actually several different buildings, each with three or four "lofts" constructed of concrete with unglazed windows. Every loft has some form of private outdoor space and many have outdoor showers. The buildings are designed to interface smoothly with the natural surroundings and as a result there are all manner of plant and (small) animal life around. We frequently saw lizards in our room and there was a set of black hummingbirds hard at work pollinating the trees on our patio. At night, the surroundings are pitch black and the only sounds you hear are insects chirping and the wind rushing through trees. The sky is so clear that you can actually see the Milky Way, a rarity for us city-dwellers.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were incredibly helpful and friendly. They made good recommendations for beaches for various purposes (reading books, snorkeling, bodysurfing, etc) and restaurants. They had snorkel equipment for us to borrow and a couple of boogie-boards as well. Every day they would stock the fridge with food to prepare for breakfast: local eggs, fresh baked bread, fresh fruit, jam, butter, milk, coffee, etc. We were also able to supplement this with some fruit from the trees on the grounds.
reviews.title: Wabi-Sabi architecture placed in heavenly setting

likes.liked: — the view, the quiet nights, the architecure and room layout, the outdoor shower, the staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, this was one of the best vacation spots I have ever been to. It is not the place for you if you equate luxury with sterility or people pampering you and scuttling about like servants. However, if you want a beautifully designed (my girlfriend is an architect and she can vouch for this), serene place to spend time on Vieques, this is for you. We can't wait to go back.
reviews.title: De-Stress!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the perfect place for us! With our windows &door always open day and night, the ocean breezes came through our room all the time - the bed was as comfortable as could be - the pillows were good, the linens were wonderful. I absolutely loved my Neeva Gayle shirt - I had to buy one before I went home -
reviews.title: Our stay at Hix House made the trip!

likes.disliked: — The service charge on the bill.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have been traveling for years, and I am always looking for this very special and unique place.
reviews.title: One of the most romantic place ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Vieques is truly one of the last paradise on earth, and the Hix is the perfect hotel to stay while you are there.
reviews.title: Go, go, go!

likes.liked: — The surroundings and the people... and the lizards! So cute!

reviews.text: From the minute you board the small plane in Fajardo, you will realize that this is a very special place you are going to.
reviews.title: One of Our Best Island Stays

reviews.text: The Hix is just adding to this fantastic experience. The concept is fabulous, the design and architectures are like anything else.

reviews.title: We Stayed in the Mattise Room 3/05
reviews.text: It is very simplistic, but offers all the services you would expect, including a splendid pool and outside - but private - shower!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: How can you describe the Hix Island House as anything but amazing. For one of the first times in my travels, the hotel lived up to the preconceptions and expectations I had created before my trip.
reviews.title: A Truly Unique, Amazing Escape!

likes.liked: — the solitude, amazing archetecture, and small comforts of home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To start, our hosts were Diane, Michael, and Joanne, three of the nicest people on the island as far as I'm concerned. Diane checked us in and led us to our place, Matisse, located in the Triangle House. Along the way, she even picked some fresh lemons and brought them up to the house for us.
reviews.title: Luxury Camping - Perfect Get Away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When you get to your room, there are plenty of windows, but no glass. No Air Con, but an amazing fan. The whole concept of the place is to fit into nature peacefully and disturb it as little as possible. And you honestly get that feel once you set foot in your space. Mosquito nets tastefully hang over the beds (and you're instructed how to use them correctly!), a lovely table with chairs, full kitchen with everything you would need to create your own meals (even some eggs for breakfast and fresh loaves of bread daily!!!), coffee press & beans, etc.
reviews.title: Lasting impressions

likes.liked: — The whole concept; interaction between design and function; natural scenery and serenity of place

reviews.text: The pool area is to die for. Clean water, beautiful views, and many times when you are totally alone! Quite rare at an island resort! I think we even spotted a concrete ping pong table a ways off into the woods. Mr. Hix did an incredible job with the design and execution of his vision.
reviews.title: Absolutely Loved HIX

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is NOT for someone looking for a pool boy serving daiquiris, a person with high maintenance needs, or your average tourist. This place is for someone looking to get away and escape. Be alone, without distraction of TV or radios... My point is that you shouldn't stay here if you like staying at a W and having a tub full of pink M&M's on arrival. This is for something looking for a bit more out of their trip than extravagance and excess.
reviews.title: I Heart The Hix House

aka: Hix Island House Hotel Isla De Vieques
description: Relax, rejuvenate and refresh midst Zen-like architectural elegance at Hix Island House, located in a 13-acre natural refuge. Our spacious lofts feature matchless Caribbean views, open-air private terraces, outdoor showers, Frette linens and luxurious lounging shirts. In-room kitchens are stocked with everything one needs to make breakfast; eggs, cereal, juice, Puerto Rican coffee, fruit, tea, jam and homemade bread. We also showcase one of the Caribbean's most magnificent pools and offer onsite Yoga and massage, daily housekeeping, full concierge and front desk services.
